website_summaries.verdict: Pair of fetch balls with a rubber core that can also float in water.
pros: Has a bright orange color, so it's easy to spot
Offers plenty of bounce, so it's fun for the dog to chase
Reasonable price point for pair of balls
cons: Pieces may break off the ball if the dog chews on it repeatedly

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 inch is the perfect size for my Maltese dogs to fetch and carry in their mouths
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know how much my Maltese girls would like a ball without a squeaker but these Chuckit Ultra Balls became an instant favorite with them. I got the 2.5 inch two pack and they both immediately began games of fetch with me. The design and size of the balls make it easy for them to pick up and carry back. The bounce is something that entices them to try to jump and capture it in the air. It’s a worthwhile addition to their toy box.
customer_reviews.author: Bichon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a dud???
customer_reviews.text: We bought several of these balls a year ago for our Australian cattle dog because they were the only balls that would hold up for her aggressive playing. We bought her some fresh ones this year and one has already split on the seam causing it to cave in on her and gave it little bounce. Considering that our furry kid’s world revolves around her ball, this is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Never met Kramer before...
customer_reviews.text: I bought for all high reviews - Kramer discredited all of them & made short work of ball! I thought would be much more durable - Lasted about 1 hour. May be OK for smaller dogs; which Kramer refers to as "SNACKS" - Certainly not up to par, for the BIG DOGS!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this brand of balls for years with my GSD's. This last batch looked different and didn't last long at all. They seem to be cheap knockoff versions of the original chuckit ball. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lewis

customer_reviews.title: beware - might be knockoffs.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many of these for my black lab. The last four I purchased have been crap. My dog ripped through them in a matter of minutes which I believe they may have been defective, knockoffs, or the manufacturer changed something in the process. I just purchased the same product from petsmart and they seem to work much better after a week of playing with there still in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Bailey has gone through a few different toys in the (almost) year I've had her.  This is absolutely her favourite.
customer_reviews.text: Bailey has gone through a few different toys in the (almost) year I've had her. This is absolutely her favourite. Just prior to this one I had tried a very solid ball, thinking it would last a long time and keep her entertained. I was wrong. Because it had very little give, it didn't evoke that predatory instinct and she quickly lost interest. This one, however, she absolutely loves. I've had it a couple of months now and she only just managed to put a rip in it. That's with constant use every day. Soon I'll break out the second one and order new ones. Excellent value for money. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ian M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: These balls are great, but......
customer_reviews.text: I have had these balls for years and they held up for months with my 2 100 lb dobermans, but when I got these last ones they would collapse when the dogs bit down on them and would take a long time to inflate again. It seems the XL balls never did it but the XXL balls don't bounce very well and don't hold the shape when being chewed on. I will just stick with the XL chuck-it ball from now on. But I still would give 5-stars to the large and X-large orange & blue chuck-it balls. They are the only ball on the market that my dobies can't destroy, and I have tried many.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: My labradoodle and I enjoy these!  Work great with the chuck it thrower
customer_reviews.text: My big 3 y/o Labradoodle loves these balls! They're a great size for his big mouth, fun to chew on and I love that they don't get all slimy and disgusting like tennis balls! They work great with the Chuck it wand we bought. After a couple weeks of being fetched and chewed on, they show no signs of wear other than color fading. They fade REALLY quickly if left outdoors, making them harder to spot while flying through the air or in dry grass sometimes. Otherwise these are great balls at a good price! Highly recommend. I did NOT receive this product for free or at a discount!
customer_reviews.author: Kate MahoneyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: You show a pair, but send only one!?
customer_reviews.text: If yer selling one ball, don't show us two balls! We kinda get worked up when we see two then realize we're talking about just one ball!!! Good quality though. Our Lab likes the size and texture. Comfortable to throw and retrieve. Good bounce and control.
customer_reviews.author: Ol blue

customer_reviews.title: Sincerely Chew Resistant
customer_reviews.text: We switched to Chuckit! Ultra Balls because our pupper was going through a new tennis ball every day. That stunk AND it was super bad for her teeth. With the Ultra balls, she's still playing with the same one she started with a month ago. It doesn't have any punctures and hasn't lost any chunks off of the ball. For comparison, our dog is a 30-pound miniature boxer who can strip the cover off of a tennis ball and break apart the insides in less than half an hour.
customer_reviews.author: ReadTheWholeBook

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best for hard chewing dogs!
customer_reviews.text: The very best ball for your pet dog, if you’ve got a hard chewer that destroys all his toys then this is definitely the best thing you can get them. I’ve went through just about 30+ balls that my pocket bully has chewed through and this has never been chewed through. Love the material and color! The only way to lose this ball in under the couch like most of mine do!
customer_reviews.author: Hoa T.

customer_reviews.title: finally a ball that lasts!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs will destroy any ball or toy that i bring home in minutes. But these balls had such great reviews, so i decided to try it for myself, and these are literally the only toys that have lasted. The squeaker chuck it balls werent as tough as my dogs chewed it apart, but these ones are awesome and still tough! I would order again and again! If your dogs are agressive chewers, i definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Weinbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for fetch
customer_reviews.text: My dog is obsessed with these balls. She only gets one when we’re playing fetch. She’ll destroy a tennis ball in 15-20 minutes. I know bigger, stronger dogs can destroy them faster, but she’s a 45 pound poodle. She’s only three years old, but already has destroyed three Kongs. My last dog had two Kong’s in her whole life. Well, whatever. This dog of mine likes to chew and destroy things. These balls last for at least a month, though. She squishes them when she retrieves them, like chewing gum, but has an extremely difficult time destroying them. I think they’re way better than a tennis ball because she can’t rip the ball to pieces.
customer_reviews.author: JulieFromCinci

customer_reviews.title: Great "Chuckit" balls!
customer_reviews.text: The puppy is fascinated with balls. He finds himself in competition with his "older" siblings who likes to take the balls and hide them from him. We needed to find MORE durable balls which we could have around the house so that the puppy could play with them. Saw this particular ball on Amazon and the reviews were outstanding. Figured "why not!" Arrived in no time at all. The puppy has been happy with these balls. We're happy too as long as it occupies the pupy's time! PROS: Durable, well-made CONS: none noted
customer_reviews.author: GeauxBucks!Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Will always purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Have bought these balls several times over the past few years. These are our dogs favorite ball. They are very durable, have great bounce, great grip if you’re just hand throwing and have noticed it has a subtle vanilla scent to them. Not sure if it is scented or it’s just the rubber that’s used, regardless these are great balls. Our dog is very active like a Jack Russell, very muscular and about 25lbs. He’s a strong biter as he’s destroyed many tennis balls gnawing. He has never penetrated one of these! Replace them when lost and always will!!
customer_reviews.author: M&Ms

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have two german shepherds and this is the only ball that can hold up to their strong bite. First, the color I chose was bright orange, which is easy to find in in the yard. Secondly, I chose the XL Ball which is larger than a tennis ball so I don't have to worry about the dogs choking on a ball that I throw to them. I've tried all the "dog" tennis balls out there from the Petsmart brand to the Martha Stewart and they don't last three minutes with my dogs. I use the Chuckit Ball to train my dogs and need something that will hold up to repeated biting and chewing. This is the best by far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t squeak, hard to destroy!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My dog can and will destroy most toys in a matter of minutes so the basic tennis balls were just not lasting long enough. I ordered these thinking maybe we’d make one last a week or so and I’m pleased to report she hasn’t even tried to tear these up. Great balls for fetch. I love that they have a high bounce too because it’s fun to watch my dog jump up and try to catch these. These are also good for the pool/beach as they float. Lastly these don’t squeak which I find wonderful as we have lots of squeakers around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Big one works with small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because I’ve bought many of the “youre dog will NEVER destroy this toy!” toys. I believe other reviews when they say their dog destroyed an undestroyable toy. These last. At least for me. We have a pretty time (20 lb terrier rot mix) and she can chew a gold brick to pieces. I bought the larger sized ball. She chomps and chomps on it, but can’t destroy it. She did destroy a smaller one. So, if you can, get one large enough that your dog can’t crank on it easily with their back teeth. Likely only possible for those with small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Shiz

customer_reviews.title: Way more durable than regular chuckit or Kong tennis balls.
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted an Australian Cattle Dog that absolutely loves fetch with a tennis ball. We already had the ChuckIt thrower but found he destroyed the regular tennis balls very quickly. Some would only last a few throws and they were split in half. This is with him only chomping on the ball while bringing it back. Had these balls for a week so far and they are still doing great. We were stuck buying a couple of these in town initially and they were over twice the price! So Amazon definitely wins on cost here.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: Dog approved
customer_reviews.text: I have a 65lb long-haired shepherd and she loves these (and so did my chocolate lab that just passed away). They are durable and throw well. She plays fetch with these primarily but does chew on them sometimes if she lays in the grass, tired of sprinting. They do bounce when they hit the ground but my dog loves to catch them when they bounce. We haven’t had an issue with the size of the ball and her size but I could see where the medium would be too small for a dog any larger than her. I just recently bought more to have on hand but don’t foresee needing them until my husband runs it over with the lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: Challice

customer_reviews.title: Chuckit ball isn’t for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: This chuckit ball says tuff and durable but soft for aggressive chewers! It lasted 2 hours and was destroyed! It’s fine playing fetch, but if you have a chewer don’t buy it. It was a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Marlene S.

customer_reviews.title: Best ball for German shepherds
customer_reviews.text: Best ball I ever purchased for my 3 1/2 year old German Shepherd. I spent a lot of money on tennis balls because that’s all he wants to do is play catch and he destroys the tennis ball each time I threw one. You can only imagine how many tennis ball he went threw. This ball is his favorite, the 3.5 inch ball. He shews on it for a good minute before dropping it but each time it’s still intact. Not to mention I lost many tennis ball he couldn’t find but this ball he always comes back with it no matter how far I threw it.
customer_reviews.author: ScenTyle

customer_reviews.title: Way better than most dog toys
customer_reviews.text: We have power chewers in our house. Most toys don't make it past a few days and those that do only last a few weeks (some unfortunate toys only last a few hours here). We have had these balls for 3 months now. They are NOT undamaged, but they certainly held up better than most toys. I had to throw one away recently because it got a puncture wound bad enough that I didn't want the dogs to get pieces of of it, but they did actually hold up pretty good to our toy destroyers.
customer_reviews.author: Bmayfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to actual Tennis Balls
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs loves to chew the fuzz of of tennis balls so we had to find a solution. We got these to give them a try and boy are we glad we did. Size wise, the 2.5" is the same size as a standard tennis ball. They bounce great and our dogs love them. A lot of rubber or plastic toys our dogs don't like, I think because they give off a smell or taste that they don't like, but these they went right after them and fight over them. o glad we gave them a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Zach P.

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very aggressive cheer who's 2 primary purposes in life are to fetch, and to chew (this dog can destroy the black kongs if she's given the opportunity). I have gone through countless racquet balls... Usually destroyed within the first 6 throws. The kong balls are too heavy and dangerous for in the house, so I was trying to find something that might be more durable than a racquet ball, but acceptable to toss in the house. These are that. She can, and does, still eventually chew them up (usually split at the seem), but they last months instead of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: DANA M.

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: My little man has been destroying toys and balls like this for years like it's no problem. FINALLY I've found a cheap, EXTREMELY WELL MADE, durable toy ball for my dude and he absolutely loves them. Once he sees one of these they are his favorite toy for the entire day, I dont know if he tries not to destroy it while gnawing on it but I've had one for an entire year with only one tear in it but still being able to use. This product absolutely cannot be beat, chuck-it tottaly hit this one out of the park.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch M

customer_reviews.title: Must Be Good - The Dog Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: The dog loves them over all other things she chews on, including sticks, rocks, and antlers. They throw well, bounce all over the place, and are easy to find in the bushes. Unfortunately, they do not float and are easily lost when the dog pounces on them in the mud. Can't say much for the durability or toughness, because she destroys all of them within minutes. If they would make it more indestructible,, like maybe out of steel, I would give it a 5-star in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: oso

customer_reviews.title: Tough
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA. I always look for products made in the USA when my dog will be chewing on it. Products made elsewhere could be made of ingredients that could harm my dogs. I only allow them to chew on these when we are playing because eventually they can chew through them ( I have German Shepherd Dogs). They are tough and during playtime they can exercise their jaws without destroying the ball. Get the chuck it thrower as well to launch the balls farther for even more fun!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Eve

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good quality for a low price!
customer_reviews.text: Not even including the low price, this is a ball toy I’ll continue to buy! My dog loves to destroy any toys you give him, and these have held up very well. The medium size I got is about the same size as a tennis ball which is what we were using before. I love the bright orange which makes it easier to see if he loses track of where it’s bouncing around in the yard. It also travels a lot faster and farther than a regular tennis ball. My pup loves it and so do I!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Faded in a couple days
customer_reviews.text: I bought these balls to throw on the beach, so I wanted them to be bright orange so I could see them against the sand. I let my dog play with one outside in my yard and in 2-3 days, it was totally faded. I know other people with Chuck It brand toys that stay outside permanently and haven't faded, so I don't know what was wrong these particular ones but I'm disappointed because I specifically wanted them to be bright so I could see them.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer than regular tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our 6 month old German shepherd who looooves these things. Unlike tennis balls he can’t chew these up, so they last a long time (although he has been able to get a tooth into it, but they don’t crumble like regular tennis balls). Also, they’re cheap enough that I don’t feel too bad if I accidentally lob it into the neighbors yard, or if they get left behind at the park. They do get slimy though, but we have the matching ball thrower so we don’t have to handle them.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than most.
customer_reviews.text: My male Rottweiler, aka Tyrannosaurus Rott, absolutely loves to chase tennis balls. They last about one day under the incredible bite strength of these pooches. Have gone through quite a number of similar items trying to find one that will last him long enough to get some enjoyment out of it without having to worry about ingesting pieces that don't travel well through the plumbing. Tried both sizes, and have to say he's given them his seal of approval as a fun chase 'n chew toy, and he hasn't yet destroyed one after two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: George J. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats tennis balls!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, don’t even hesitate this purchase. These balls are great. They are super durable; they hold up very well. They fit perfectly in the Chuck It Launcher and the bright color makes it easy for my dog to find in the Utah snow. They are more expensive than a classic tennis ball but my dog goes through a pack of $2 tennis balls in 2 weeks and these balls have never been damaged in anyway by my pup. Like I said- incredibly durable. We’ve lost a few at the dog park so this Amazon deal is a perfect time for us to restock!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsy

customer_reviews.title: Best dog ball on the market!!
customer_reviews.text: These dog balls are awesome! The Medium is Tennis ball size, and is great! They don’t puncture even with the hardest chews. They float, can easily be washed, and they bounce. The Large and XL are almost too big for my Goldendoodle’s mouth, but she still plays with them. “Plays” is not the right term...she’s OBSESSED with them. Literally, it’s the only toy she wakes up to find and keeps with her all day.
customer_reviews.author: Kimbo Slice

customer_reviews.title: Much different than past orders.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many of these balls in the past but in the last two orders of these balls my dog will not play with them. I noticed a different smell to the new order. Maybe they changed the way these are being made but all 8 of the last balls I have ordered have gone into the trash. I will be looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mosabell

customer_reviews.title: Puts Kong to shame!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is almost indestructible! Our dog will completely shred a normal tennis ball in about 2 minutes. This ball lasts about 3-4 MONTHS, even with her chewing on it daily! Once she finally manages to chew a hole in these chuck-it balls, we know it's got less than a week to live, so then we order another one. Yes the price seems high for just one ball, but it will last, and end up costing less than buying the 500 regular balls the dog would go through in the same amount of time you own this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gibson99

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality
customer_reviews.text: WARNING UPDATE: Not sure what happened to the manufacturing of this ball but that last order was a bust! Within a week of giving it to our dog the balls broke in two! Not the same quality and we are very disappointed. I won't buy this ball again. Sturdy ball for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.author: vrrein

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY! Great quality and value!
customer_reviews.text: These balls are fantastic! We play fetch with our pups everyday at our pond for hours and hours each week. They launch perfectly from the plastic launchers. They’re very sturdy and hold up to big dogs. They are very easy to clean with a hose and the best part, they float! We’ll NEVER use tennis balls again. We have quite a few of these and besides the dog hiding them, have never had one break, crack or show any signs of wear. These are a must buy if your dog loves fetch.
customer_reviews.author: Globemaster 3

customer_reviews.title: Instant love
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have is my 30 pound 11/2 year old fur child loves this ball to much. Everytime I turn around there is a chuck it ball. I am peacefully sleeping and I roll over smushing my face into a chuck it ball. I was wrong to think 4 was to many. I may buy a second set so I can rotate washing them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY STURDY BALL
customer_reviews.text: MY GERMAN SHEPHERD REALLY LIKES THESE. THEY HAVE SOME WEIGHT TO THEM. ONLY THING IS MY SHEPHERD CATCHES FROM LIKE 25FT AWAY. I WOULD HAVE BEEN BETTER OFF WITH THE SMALLER ONES. IT WOULD HAVE MADE IT EASIER FOR HIM TO CATCH. I HAVE CONCERNS WITH THEM ALWAYS STRIKING HIS K9s. THE SMALLER BALL WOULD DROP INTO HIS MOUTH EASIER. YOU CANT GO WRONG WITH THESE THEY ARE WELL MADE. NOTE IM BASING MY REVIEW ON A DOG THAT POPS TENNIS BALLS.
customer_reviews.author: TONY M

customer_reviews.title: Not very tough
customer_reviews.text: I write this knowing that my dog is notorious for being very chewy. She can put away a tennis ball in a matter of two or three minutes if she wants. So I was reading reviews of this ball and it seemed tough enough for her to try. Seemed pretty tough upon opening the package, but after about 10 minutes of her undivided attention she had put quite the hole in it (see photo). So sadly, I must say that if your dog is good at chewing things and you always have to shop for the toughest toys for them to have, this is not the ball for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Adams

customer_reviews.title: Truly chew proof!
customer_reviews.text: My lab/border collie cross is a ball FIEND. He goes nuts for balls. Sadly, tennis balls are quickly toast after he is done with them. Then one day we were out for a walk when he found an old Chuckit ball. It was worn and faded but still worked. I washed it up and let him have at it. Well I am so impressed that it is indeed chew proof! He will chew it for what seems like hours and it still survives! Luckily the ball had the brand on it so I went to buy a few more to sprinkle around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Chloemum

customer_reviews.title: Not like the Smaller ones
customer_reviews.text: 1st off they advertise 2 balls in there add for xxlarge ball stating1 pack. Well you only get 1 ball. It does not bounce like the other chuck it balls. Also does not let air out like the others so gets stuck in and gets out of shape. If it was just like the others made with the thicker rubber and bounce good and air came out it would be the best on The Market but it’s not will stay with the large or med ones can’t destroy them.
customer_reviews.author: Profyi

customer_reviews.title: Great rubber ball for heavy chewer
customer_reviews.text: My 100 lb lab retriever loves these balls. They are the perfect size to fit in his mouth and chew on for long periods of time. We purchased this set after he unknowingly stole one of these same balls from a mini poodle. The last ball he had lasted about 4 months before he busted through the rubber. For big dogs that are heavy chewers I estimate the ball lasting 4-6 months. For small to medium size pups I would imagine the balls will last longer. I purchased the medium balls on sale at a great prize. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amo

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible!!! Perfect for black lab!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best ball to have with a black lab. Our lab has destroyed baseballs, tennis balls, frisbees and basically everything in between but loves to play fetch. We found that the lacrosse ball works well but then if she catches it, her teeth basically get shattered. Then we tried this and we have had the same ball for 4 months and still her favorite toy! I have bought about 6 of these to have in stock when the ball goes missing or gets thrown over the fence and lost. Get this ball if your dog(s) destroy every toy!
customer_reviews.author: Elitemojo1

customer_reviews.title: Great for playing on the beach or near the water ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a higher quality ball than the regular Chuck it ball or tennis balls. Great for playing on the beach or near the water because the rubber coating repeals water. Also durable to continuous biting and high bouncing. Combined with the Chuckit! 26 M launcher, I can throw the ball much farther than I can throw it and can pick the ball up off the ground easily. Watch my demonstration video.
customer_reviews.author: RC Beach Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Best balls ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have a mutant Chihuahua that will destroy anything she can get her tiny teeth on. Anything. I’ve tried all kinds of chew toys and balls and nothing lasts more than 5-10 minutes. Things my Labrador or my Dutch Shepherd won’t destroy, the Chih will rip to shreds. She’s not allowed to be alone with toys, until now. She has not been able to chew bits of this off, and trust me- she has tried. These are thick, good bounce level, great size. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: German Sheperds!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs really like these balls. They fetch them just like they do a regular tennis ball. I have one picky dog who is very selective on the tennis ball she might choose to chase and retrieve (it cannot be too soggy or flat or....) so I wasn't sure if she would like these. But she doesn't seem to think they are any different than a "perfect" tennis ball. I do pick them up after we have our fetch time so I don't know if they are more durable or not... but they sure look like they could be as they are thicker and more dense feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Spuds

customer_reviews.title: One ball to outlast them all...
customer_reviews.text: Our Standard Poodle loves to chew on her play ball. Most balls have a lifetime in hours in her attentive care. Dollar store balls last less than an hour. Sure, this ball costs more but has lasted longer than any previous ball we gave her. How would I describe the quality? I would venture to say that the Ball could qualify for a Mil Spec if sold to the Military. My dog loves the ball and my wife loves that the ball is indestructible and doesn’t break into a million pieces like the previous balls did.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: My small cockapoo Lady loves it them. Use to play with her using a tennis ball but it was a bit to big for her mouth and it left that lime green fuss on her tongue. These balls are a bit smaller than a tennis ball and has more bounce to them. The material seem thought enough to support her chewing on it or when she bites a bit hard on it. Overall it’s a great product... did had to buy 2 packs of 2 balls Instead of just one pack but I guess it can’t hurt to have more balls
customer_reviews.author: Christopher José Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves these durable balls
customer_reviews.text: Chuckit ball (small size) is perfect for my puppy. Very durable and strong material, again my puppy is still young and not strong chewer. It bounceS well from floor and rolls bit heavily & slow compared to regular tennis ball, which is good thing. My puppy looses an interest after several chews though when he catches it. Maybe because of its rugged texture. He just enjoys catch and run with these balls.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: My Big Boy luvs Chuckit balls
customer_reviews.text: These Chunkit Balls are great, the dogs luv em more than kongs. And the smaller balls I started buying a few months ago and they are still with there favorite toys but, last longer. He even checks during his naps and makes sure he still has as many as he can control, they both have there balls. I had to buy several to stop them fighting over 2, So 8 works, lol. Update.. I have bought 9 sets, Great price $4.49. Best balls ever, Both Rottweilers love them they chew for hours and all balls even outside never destroyed by weather or teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Means

customer_reviews.title: Literally the only toy my dog hasn't destroyed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Siberian Husky who apparently has a full time job destroying any toy she is given. I have bought 'virtually indestructible' balls and toys for her, only to find them in 200 pieces a mere four hours later. She shreads tennis balls, etc. too. She loves chewing on and playing with these balls (haha) and has yet to destroy one. They keep her entertained and have lasted for months longer than any others I have purchased! I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: No complaints...one happy dog.
customer_reviews.text: I am an owner of an 85-lb lab, who loves to fetch balls and chew on them. My dog LOVES these, and while the medium is about the same size as a tennis ball, we prefer these since she has significantly worn down her canine teeth with 11 yrs of chewing on tennis ball felt with dirt granules. We say, "she likes a good chew," and she definitely likes to give it some chomps before dropping it for another throw...these are definitely more durable than most toys, but eventually she does puncture them (after a year+ of regular use).
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Buster's chomp-approved XL size Ultra Ball
customer_reviews.text: Using the "original size" Chuckit I can easily lob this ball over 100 feet; and I am 67 years old. When it comes down on frozen ground this ball bounces up 8-10 feet which delights our Buster (125# small pony of 3/4 Lab &1/4 Pit). He loves to chomp down on and retrieve this ball. He also makes sure he brings it back into the house. When time to go out he runs to grab it so I can throw it a few times. The inner core of the tennis ball version that came with our Chuckit split in half, either due to the cold weather or Buster's chomp. This ball should hold up fine.
customer_reviews.author: SPARTY 047

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness!
customer_reviews.text: I was really tired of chewed up dirty tennis balls with holes in them. Our dog LOVES to drop the chewed up balls into the pool. Thankful that these exist so she can chew them up, chase them, drop them in the pool and swim after them without the gross dirty slobery tennis ball-ness. If you forget about the ball, it will fade some in the sun but DUH. it's an outdoor dog ball. Love them. Dog loves them. win win win win.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Meenaghan

customer_reviews.title: Balls
customer_reviews.text: My dogs really like these balls. I have 3 dogs and we go out to the field 3 or 4 times a day to play. I like using the throwing stick so I can throw them farther and make them bounce. My dogs like these balls better than tennis balls but I have to take them away when we are done playing because they can still chew holes in them. One of my shepherds loves carrying it around with he all when I will let him have it. I have a mixed Pitbull that can chew holes in them. I still like them very much
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money over cheap tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: We bought two sets of these to play fetch with our 7 month old lab/collie puppy. We used to just buy cheap tennis balls because our other dog, a 5 year old lab, loves to destroy them. So far these rubber balls are proving to be not only fun for fetch, but they are also holding to up to our super chewer. Usually if our lab can’t destroy it, he loses interest and won’t play with it, but with these, he just carries one around and chews on it. It still looks brand new though!
customer_reviews.author: Brody Robinaugh

customer_reviews.title: Price went up, Quality went down!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like these balls. It used to fit on to the handle now it seems like it is slightly smaller, it kept falling out of the tossing head. also one of my dogs poke a hole right through them and they become deflated to where it doesn't bounce well. Also, these balls come 2 on a pack and charge one price now they want to charge for 2 balls even though it is one package. What I am saying is the price went up but the quality went down!
customer_reviews.author: Pip

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a ball my dog can’t destroy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good ball. I have a dachshund who loves to chew up his toys, especially any type of ball. He loves tennis balls, and because this one is similar in size and looks, he has tried hard to annihilate it. He hasn’t succeeded and won’t. I thought he would lose interest if he couldn’t destroy it, but he loves the thing and guards it like it’s a bone. It has a decent bounce—suitable to indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Romoca

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd approved
customer_reviews.text: I have an 85 lb German Shepherd who is in a very aggressive chewer and besides the softball that we don't like him playing with because we're scared of our toes this one seems to hold up to him and he loves it The last one he had he had for probably about a year and one of his teeth poked a hole in it and he buried it and dirt took black It was time for a new one
customer_reviews.author: Tarah

customer_reviews.title: Tennis Ball Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I got these balls after reading that tennis balls act as sandpaper and wear down your dogs teeth when they fill with dirt. My hound mix loves to play ball, it's hard to get her to chase anything else. And she's smart enough to know if the ball isn't the usual one she's been chasing. I got these because of the texture hoping she wouldn't mind/notice. So far so good, she chases them well, and I'm not concerned about her teeth wearing down more from wool and built up dirt.
customer_reviews.author: char

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Only downside is they fade if left in the sun. Like within one day. So don't leave them outside. Otherwise easy to see when your dog decides she doesn't want to chase it and you have to go find it. mostly chew proof. My belgian hasn't destroyed one, but her friend Cane Corso pops them pretty quickly. my belgian prefers the glow in the dark variant.
customer_reviews.author: xP.1337

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We had a Chuckit ball before that my dog loved. But it got lost in a neighbors yard. I didn’t buy that ball, I think it was a gift a long time ago so I wasn’t sure which exact style it was. I just knew it was one of the only ones my dog never tore up. So I stumbled across these. They were a different color but I decided to try it. She loves these! And hasn’t wanted to tear them apart! She’s a pit bull, 50+ pounds for size reference.
customer_reviews.author: MommyFox2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Fetch.  She Likes to Chew Them Too.
customer_reviews.text: They are cute, fun, and the size we picked was perfect. The price was amazing. The puppy is a destructive chewer, but she does not seem to want to totally destroy balls so some chewing has left the balls almost like new. They throw well for fetch, they bounce well on concrete for "fetch/jump" and they are fairly easy to spot in the grass. I really feel great about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeAlert

customer_reviews.title: Great size for the biggest dogs
customer_reviews.text: Long-time user of the Chuck-It! balls. They're durable, bright, and a huge hit with all types of dogs. We previously had been using mediums with our Lab. However, we have a Daniff now, and his mouth is bigger. Much bigger. XXL is the biggest size I could find, and it does wonderfully. Large enough that there's no chance he can choke on it, but still a good size for his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Scott

customer_reviews.title: Vader loves it !!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Shepard has destroyed every toy brought into my home Until this ball . There is a reason this has the ratings that it does if you have a heavy chewier this is the ball for you don’t hesitate get this ball into your home!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Mom 38

customer_reviews.title: Durable with a good bounce
customer_reviews.text: If your dog loves balls, get a chuckit! They have a good bounce while having a tough shell that my pits can’t get through. Our dogs destroy baseballs, tennis balls, almost everything but the chuckits really last. I think they lose them before they destroy any! Bright colors so easy to find, medium seems to be the average tennis ball like size.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lenhart

customer_reviews.title: Size up and use forever
customer_reviews.text: I really like these balls and my dog is obsessed, but watch for sizing. I thought medium would be fine for a medium dog, but I have a husky and this is a definite choking hazard. Size up if you have a medium dog. The large is perfect for her. Otherwise, these are very durable, smell like cupcakes, rinse well, water is easily squeezed out can and they bounce very high.
customer_reviews.author: lt

customer_reviews.title: Longest lasting ball we've had yet!
customer_reviews.text: She LOVES to play ball, but the problem is shes likes to tear them up just as much. This is the longest lasting ball shes had. It still bounces good and we have lots of play left in it. It's actually been a couple MONTHS! None of her other balls have lasted more than a week. Great job Chuckit brand and to whoever's involved in this particular creation!! Only downside is my fault, I bought the medium size because it was on sale, unfortunately it just fits under the furniture. So I'll be buying it again in the bigger size :)
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Better than the tennis ball!
customer_reviews.text: We like these Chuckit balls for a few reasons. First is that they are heavier, so fly farther. They have a blue band that my dog can see, and orange so we can see, after it lands. Dogs can only see shades of blue and yellow, so orange and green are the same shade of grey to them. The blue they can see, and the orange WE people can see! The rubber these balls are made of are better than the fuzzy tennis ball that the Chuckit came with. That ball got gross, fast. These balls you can rise off and dry. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Becky W.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Fit Under the Couch ;)
customer_reviews.text: Even though our dog is only 20 lbs, I ordered the XXL ball because his favorite game in the world is to nudge a ball under the couch and then bark at us to get it. He can still run around with it in his mouth, but we no longer have to deal with digging his ball out from under the couch! It hasn’t been destroyed yet in any way, but I believe one of our dogs has been able to sink a tooth into it and make a slit. Thankfully, they still haven’t been able to utilize the slit in order to chew it up into pieces!
customer_reviews.author: T.Vallster

customer_reviews.title: Loved by dogs and humans alike!
customer_reviews.text: Once my puppy started chewing off fray from cheap tennis balls I knew these chuck it balls would be worth a try. He LOVES them. They are a little big for his tiny puppy mouth for now but the blue grooves provide a perfect grip so he can still pick them up easily. He constantly chews on these and there are still no signs of destruction. They're easily rinsed off after playing outside and will definitely last a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These balls hold up to an aggressive chewer.
customer_reviews.text: After going through a big bag of dog tennis balls in less than one week (the dog could destroy one within minutes), I am amazed by the ChuckIt balls. my Mountain Cur has not been able to destroy any of them yet, even when left to chew on them. They have a good bounce, easy to throw and have lasted. I first ordered 6, and just ordered another 2 so we can chuck away to tire her out some.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size! Our pit bull mix literally destroys toys, even the most durable Kong’s within minutes, cuz kings have a hole in them that allows him to grip wit( his front canine and weaken it. However, these balls don’t have that and they also float, so they are perfect in the pool. Love these balls! So far they are the only toy that lasts atleast 24 hours to a few weeks. Our pup has a jaw of steel. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: starr

customer_reviews.title: Too large & don't squeak
customer_reviews.text: I goofed! I ONLY buy Chuckit Balls for my 10 lb dog so when I saw these on sale so I jumped on ordering. When they arrived I discovered I ordered Medium instead of Small. Although they look identical to the ones I normally order these do not squeak. Instead of returning them (too big for my dog) I gave them to a neighbor with bigger dogs who had never purchased Chuckit Balls before. I'm sure they will be a new customer!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A.

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't great for pool use, but awesome outside the pool.
customer_reviews.text: Chuckit is a solid ball for playing fetch, my dog loves it and it has withstood hundreds of tosses and bites from my dog. I have one negative, the description showed it was great for the water, but my experience suggest otherwise. From the very first toss, I threw it in the pool and the dog loved it. After playing in the pool for a bit, the inside of the ball had water in it and I could not find a hole to allow it to drain. I had to use a nail to make a hole on the side so the water wouldn't turn into mildew just stuck inside. Out of the pool, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that survives a super-chewer
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a super chewer, tennis balls and the like don’t last a day in our house, and these things are his favorite (Belgian Mal mix). They usually last a month or so of HEAVY use, before they sometimes get a split at the seam. But still, they’re the only toys that even last that long. Totally work it. Additionally, they have an almost-vanilla sent to them which is way better than the usual plastic aroma toys usually start with.
customer_reviews.author: Bourn

customer_reviews.title: Will Definitely Buy More!
customer_reviews.text: My dog around 7 years old and has taken up chewing up all of her toys. I bought these as a test to see if she would destroy it in a matter of minutes. However, these have held up and she loves them! They are super lightweight and easy to throw, have a little bounce so it always goes further than I can throw which is great. I bought them for my mother in laws German Shepard as well and he loves them just as much!
customer_reviews.author: missb

customer_reviews.title: Nearly indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Our GSD is a ball hog, and would put Payton Lafferty to shame. She loves fetch but gets possessive and a lot of the time only drops a ball if you’ve already got one in your hands. So the two pack was great. She’s destroyed a lot of balls, these are the only two that still have retained their shape in the two+ months we’ve had them. She can crush tennis balls and other softer balls within a day but these have held up so far. Not even really any tooth marks or damage yet, either. They’re her preferred choice too when she gets an option. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: My 70 pound mutt will chew through a tennis ball in one fetch. I went with the extra large so he’s less likely to choke on it and he can’t get as much leverage to crush it and so far he has not been able to destroy it. We’ve only had it about a week, so I can’t tell how long it will last, but so far it doesn’t have any holes or major scratches and it’s still round. It also bounces well, which my dog loves.
customer_reviews.author: KKN

customer_reviews.title: Lab Approved
customer_reviews.text: Well I have written reviews on the Chuckit System and have said how much my Lab LOVES, oh wait obsesses over these! I can not begin to tell you how many balls I have bought! Funny thing is I just found out what he is doing with them! I thought he was loosing them, however much to my surprise one day we have no balls next day we have 3! I think he hides them to make me BUY NEW ones!!!! Lol So my review on theses are not what you want to hear but, my labs review however are very very good! They can take a beating, chewing and whatever he decides to do with them!
customer_reviews.author: Diana L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable
customer_reviews.text: Two of my dogs shred tennis balls but love to play fetch. We tried the chuck it balls to see if they would hold up and we have not had any that were shredded or had any marks/holes. I’ve now ordered close to 20 of these (since somehow they get lost under beds and couches lol) and I know these will last for years and years. Side note- I have a Doberman and two boxers and the Doberman and our male boxer are the ball shredders. This ball can literally withstand a Doberman!
customer_reviews.author: lexi

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy toy balls
customer_reviews.text: These balls are very sturdy and I don't think my dog will be able to damage them. They came really quickly and are just what I was looking for. There is no squeaker but that is ok....easier to get back from him. Had bought a thrower from the dollar store and these medium size fit perfectly. The bright orange is much easier to see in the grass when he gets distracted and I have to be the retriever! Plan on ordering more of the same. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Put Bull Tested, Pit Bull Approved
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my friend's rescued Pit Bull! She loves it! Balls are like a security blanket for her and she's notorious for destroying them in no time but one week later and the ball has no damage!
customer_reviews.author: Garland R.

customer_reviews.title: My dog is obsessed with these
customer_reviews.text: Bought several packs when they were on lightening deal since my dog is obsessed with these. They are virtually indestructible. My dog normally destroys toys but these she loses before she destroys (like dropping down a storm drain the first day she had one haha). She is content to just lay down and chew this thing FOREVER. Not as cheep as regular tennis balls, but we don't find random hunts of rubber laying around when she has these.
customer_reviews.author: Student Baker

customer_reviews.title: Best ball for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is not a ball to give your rescue pitbull when you’re not playing fetch. It will however last a really long time if you play with it and put away. Left with it in the car or at home for more than 5 minutes this you will be in pieces ready for you to clean it up. I recommend the thrower to go along with it so you’re hands don’t get slobbery playing fetch as the ball is already sort of slick to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: gizmo1086

customer_reviews.title: their new favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: i bought these on a whim, they’re pretty inexpensive and had good reviews- i couldn’t have made a better choice! our LARGE dogs can’t put these down - they love them! i was expecting the balls to be in pieces within hours but so far they’ve ben indestructible. VERY happy with this purchase! **update- out of three dogs our heaviest chewer destroyed the ball within a few weeks. still happy with the product and durability and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: constance

customer_reviews.title: Best ball I've ever found
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. They float, are bright and don't get lost easily, have a good bounce to them, and are miraculously still in tact after months of being knawed on by my pittie. They fit the ball thrower I bought separately. It's the same brand but I guess the ball thrower comes in different sizes or models? Anyway, 10/10 for this ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Casey

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite ball
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredibly durable. My dog will chomp and squish it repeatedly and it's still in great shape! The only negative thing I've noticed is the color fades very fast when left outside. I left the ball in the grass for a day or two and you could see where the sun hit it vs where the grass was. Not a big deal, but worth noting. Now we have an outside ball and inside ball!
customer_reviews.author: K. Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a tennis ball but it's better!
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked to award 5 stars in all those durability categories but we haven't had them long enough. Be aware that these look like plain old tennis balls, but they're far better. Most of the dog balls we've purchased are really stale tennis balls. The dogs love to fetch them and my gut feeling is they will last a long time. Certainly they will last longer than the usual tennis balls, which the dogs have skinned in about 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Over hyped - My dog won't play with it.
customer_reviews.text: This ball is certainly chew proof and durable (same as longevity) only if my dog and my neighbor's dog will play with it. Yes, I gifted one to my neighbor's dog (this comes in a pack of 2). both dogs ignore it ... to "heavy " to gift this to a child to throw around because it is hard and somewhat heavy. Will break a window certainly when throwing in the wrong direction or hurt some kids in the process. It is kept in a drawer for ???
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Just get it
customer_reviews.text: I hear people all the time that say their dogs are heavy chewers and they have nothing on my dog. Toys that are supposedly chew proof or long lasting are torn to pieces in under 10 minutes but this ball has survived with no damage for 3 months now. He loves this ball, it's great for chewing and for every day play. He even sleeps with it. I was upset because one day last week he had chewed it so much it concaved into itself but a few minutes later it had returned to its original form and is still doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Jo C.

customer_reviews.title: High-bouncing fetch balls!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use regular tennis balls for my dog to fetch at the dog park. These bounce way higher and my dog loves that! They also stay cleaner than tennis balls, as they have a rubbery texture that rinses right off. They work great with my Chuck It stick! The only negative is that I had to order 2 packs (4 balls) in order to purchase. I didn’t need that many but these aren’t sold just one pack at a time for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Cavender

customer_reviews.title: Possible choking hazard!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this company's balls in the past and they were fine. This last pair (purchased in 2016, but not needed until recently) have a SERIOUS defect. They develop a discoloration,which is the size of a quarter, and which soon begins to separate from the rest of the ball. Glued to the inside of this circle is a plastic spiral/spring. I have no idea what it's for. If the circle does its final separation while caught in the air it could easily slip into a dog's throat!! Definitely a serious problem!!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis P

customer_reviews.title: Dogs most loved toy
customer_reviews.text: These are my dogs favorite balls. We have bought other brands/kinds & she won't even look at them. Her original ball was bought when she was a puppy & she's almost 2 now & still loves it. We have been through tons of other toys that she tears to pieces in a short amount of time. This ball is still in 1 piece, just faded from being lost in the yard (& then found!). We had to buy more for when they inevitably get lost in the yard (or under the couch).
customer_reviews.author: Derreck B.

customer_reviews.title: Price Nearly Doubled!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these and they were a great price on Amazon at $4.79 for the two ball pack. They are durable, but by no means indestructible for heavy chewers. However, it seems now the price has nearly doubled, so I won’t be purchasing these from here. They sell them at homegoods, TJ Maxx as well! When prices double or increase significantly on Amazon in a very short amount of time I do not repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Pagano

customer_reviews.title: Great balls, Our dogs love them!!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love these balls!! Even though they can puncture them with their teeth occasionally, especially our lab, the balls retain their shape and last a very long time. Don't have to worry about broken teeth either. Our Border Collie and lab catch these mid air so they are perfect. Just replaced the ones we've had for years :-)
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Outlasted The Destroyer... aka my German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time buying Chuckit! brand balls and i'm very happy. Medium is definitely a small by bigger breed standards (but definitely medium to smaller breeds). My German Shepherd destroys ALL "long-lasting", "virtually indestructible" toys but these rubber ones are still here after months. I was very impressed that i purchased the chuckit! launcher in Large with larger balls. I even purchased the squeaker ones (bitter sweet that they last forever lol).
customer_reviews.author: Ruben M

customer_reviews.title: Well....
customer_reviews.text: If you have a dog that's a serious chewer, this might not be for you. I cannot give it a low star because my pit loves chewing and has so far destroyed every toy he has every gotten a hold of. However, it did last for a few weeks before he shredded it, which really surprised me as I don't expect anything to last very long. He really did love it while it lasted and would always 'put it up' (Put it in his food bowl so it wouldn't roll away) after he was done playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie2

product_meta.title: Chuckit! Ultra Ball,
product_meta.description: Color:Multi| Size:Medium, 2.5-Inch, 2-PackThe Chuckit! Ultra dog toy ball is the ultimate fetch ball, designed to bounce higher, float better, last longer, and stand out from the rest. Made from natural, high-bounce rubber, the Ultra Ball encourages dogs to leap and jump for more stimulating games of fetch. Featuring an extra-thick rubber core, these dog fetch toys are durable for long-term use, yet lightweight and buoyant as water toys for dogs. Chuckit! Ultra Balls are strong dog toys that hold up to dirt and slobber and are easy to wipe clean. The bright orange and blue design grabs dogs' attention in the air and can be easily spotted in tall grass or on water. Available in five sizes ranging from small to XX-large, dogs of all sizes can enjoy fetch with the Chuckit! Ultra Ball. Two-packs are available in select sizes for pet parents to keep an extra Ultra Ball on hand. The Chuckit! Ultra Ball is compatible with the Chuckit! ball launcher for dogs, enhancing fetch with slobber-free pickup and long-distance throws.
feature_bullets: ULTRA BOUNCE BALL: This ball toy for dogs entices play withhigh impact bouncing! Play fetch at the lake or pool thanks to the lightweight, buoyant design. Compatible with Chuckit! ball launcher.
TOUGH & DURABLE: Rubber ball for dogs has a textured surface & a thick rubber core for aggressive chewers yet is soft on dog's mouths.

PET TOYS: Get ready for bonding & fun with your dogs & cats! Check out a variety of our pet toy products such as frisbees, perches & mirrors for birds, prey wand toys for cats, plush toys, light-up interactive toys & more.

CHUCKIT! FETCH TOYS: Chuckit! creates toys that enrich the human-animal bond & bright colors help dogs & puppies stay engaged. Checkout Chuckit! for ball launchers, bouncy balls, frisbees, indoor dog toys, glow toys & more!

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit! , Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
